topic.title: Configuring Ceph to use OpenStack Services (Glance)

body.p: This page describes the procedure to configure Ceph as a default Glance store. Currently, Swift is used as the default Glance store.

section.title: Configure Ceph as Glance Store
section.p:
Perform the following procedure on the Deployer node to configure Ceph as a default Glance store:
Edit ~/helion/my_cloud/config/glance/glance-api.conf.j2 to add the following values. default_store = rbd stores = rbd rbd_store_pool = images rbd_store_user = glance rbd_store_ceph_conf = /etc/ceph/ceph.conf rbd_store_chunk_size = 8
In the same file comment out the following references to Swift:stores = {{ glance_stores }} default_store = {{ glance_default_store }}
Copy ceph.client.glance.keyring to all the controller nodes:
Login to controller node as a root user and execute the following command.ceph auth get-or-create client.glance | tee /etc/ceph/ceph.client.glance.keyring
OR
You can copy the keyring from the deployer nodescp /etc/ceph/ceph.client.glance.keyring to /etc/ceph folder on all the controller nodes.
Commit your configuration to the local repository to configure cinder on the deployer node.
cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>"
Run the following command to create a deployment directory.cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run the following ansible playbook:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts glance-reconfigure.yml

body.p: Once glance is configured, any image creation will use Ceph as the default data store.
